measured_by: German version of the BIS/BAS scale
justification: "We used the German version of the BIS/BAS scale… The BIS/BAS scale measures two motivational systems: the behavioral inhibition system (BIS)…"

measured_by: German version of the BIS/BAS scale
justification: The same passage states that the BIS/BAS questionnaire "measures… the behavioral activation system (BAS)."

measured_by: BAS Drive subscale of the BIS/BAS scale
justification: "The three components of BAS compose the remaining three subscales. BAS Drive measures the motivation to pursue desired goals…" indicating this sub-scale operationalizes BAS Drive.

measured_by: BAS Reward Responsiveness subscale of the BIS/BAS scale
justification: The text lists "BAS Reward Responsiveness focuses on positive responses to pleasant reinforcers," identifying the subscale that measures this construct.

measured_by: BAS Fun Seeking subscale of the BIS/BAS scale
justification: It also notes that "BAS Fun Seeking comprises items that measure the motivation to approach new rewards spontaneously," tying the construct to that subscale.
"The task captures two motivational phases: invigoration and effort maintenance," indicating the Effort Allocation Task operationalizes the construct of invigoration.
The same sentence specifies that effort maintenance is the second phase assessed within the Effort Allocation Task.
"Participants were presented sequentially with two visual analogue scales inquiring about exertion and wanting of the reward at stake after every effort phase…" thus the VAS measures wanting.
The identical sentence names a second VAS that "inquir[es] about exertion," linking the exertion construct to that scale.
